BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: THE NATIONAL SOCIETY OF COLONIAL DAMES

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: RECOGNITION OF NATIONAL HERITAGE VIA HISTORIC PRESERVATION, PATRIOTIC SERVICE & EDUCATIONAL PROJECTS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE NATIONAL SOCIETY OF THE COLONIAL DAMES OF AMERICA IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA (NSCDA/PA) IS DEDICATED TO FURTHERING AN APPRECIATION OF OUR NATIONAL HERITAGE THROUGH HISTORIC PRESERVATION, PATRIOTIC SERVICE AND EDUCATIONAL PROJECTS.
IRS990.Desc: THE NSCDA/PA IS AN ORGANIZATION OF WOMEN THAT ACTIVELY PROMOTES AN APPRECIATION OF AMERICA'S HERITAGE THROUGH PRESERVATION, PATRIOTIC SERVICE, AND EDUCATIONAL PROJECTS. SINCE 1899, THE NSCDA/PA HAS ADMINISTERED STENTON, THE C.1730 HOME OF WILLIAM PENN'S SECRETARY, JAMES LOGAN. TODAY, STENTON IS WHERE MANY OF THE SOCIETY'S EXCITING PUBLIC AND SCHOOL-AGE PROGRAMS TAKE PLACE, INCLUDING THE NATIONAL AWARD-WINNING HISTORY HUNTERS PROGRAM, WHICH SERVES OVER 3,000 PHILADELPHIA SCHOOLCHILDREN EACH YEAR. A MEMBER OF HISTORIC GERMANTOWN, STENTON WORKS CLOSELY WITH THIS PARTNERSHIP OF 16 EXTRAORDINARY HISTORIC HOUSES AND DESTINATIONS TO PROTECT, PRESERVE, AND SHARE SOME OF PHILADELPHIA'S MOST IMPORTANT HISTORICAL ASSETS. (CONTINUED ON SCHEDULE O.)THE SOCIETY ALSO SUPPORTS WOODVILLE, A HISTORIC HOUSE MUSEUM LOCATED NEAR PITTSBURGH, AND PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR PROJECTS RELATING TO PATRIOTIC SERVICE AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, SUCH AS NATIONAL HISTORY DAY.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER MISC INCOME - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 4,931. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 6,129. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 4,507. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 3,411. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 5,830. GROSS SALES OF INVENTORY - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 319. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 1,246. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 260. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 848. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 773.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION OWNS FOR PUBLIC EXHIBITION, EDUCATION AND RESEARCH VARIOUS WORKS OF ART, HISTORICAL ARTIFACTS AND FURNISHINGS. THESE ITEMS, AS PERMITTED BY ASC 958, ARE NOT RECORDED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE ORGANIZATION.
THE COLLECTIONS FURTHER THE MISSION BY INCREASING THE APPRECIATION OF OUR NATIONAL HERITAGE FOR THE BEHOLDERS OF THE ITEMS.

THE PURPOSE OF THE SOCIETY'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO ENABLE THE SOCIETY THROUGH A TOTAL RETURN INVESTMENT STRATEGY TO MORE COMPLETELY FULFILL ITS MISSION BEYOND WHAT IS POSSIBLE THROUGH ITS ANNUAL OPERATING FUNDS, AND THEREFORE, DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS SHALL BE LIMITED TO THE AMOUNT PERMITTED UNDER THE SPENDING RULE POLICY FOR THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ESTABLISHED BY THE BOARD OF MANAGERS. THE SOCIETY'S POLICY IS ALSO TO MAINTAIN THE VALUE OF THE PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED INVESTMENT BALANCE AT THE VALUE OF THE GIFTS DERIVED FROM THE DATES OF THE ORIGINAL GIFTS.

THE SOCIETY IS EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). THE SOCIETY EVALUATES ITS INCOME TAX POSITIONS EACH FISCAL YEAR TO DETERMINE WHETHER ANY TAX POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED IF EXAMINED BY THE APPLICABLE TAXING AUTHORITY. THE REVIEW OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS HAD NO IMPACT ON THE SOCIETY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE PRESIDENT, FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT, SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT, RECORDING SECRETARY, CORRESPONDING SECRETARY, TREASURER, REGISTRAR, AND THE HISTORIAN. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY MEET TO CONDUCT THE BUSINESS OF THE ORGANIZATION BETWEEN BOARD MEETINGS AND WILL REPORT ANY ACTIONS TO THE BOARD FOR RATIFICATION AT ITS FOLLOWING MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS ONE CLASS OF MEMBERS. MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO BE DIRECT DESCENDANTS OF AN ANCESTOR WHO LIVED IN AN AMERICAN COLONY AND WHO RENDERED SERVICE TO THE COLONIES BEFORE JULY 5, 1776. MEMBERSHIP IS BY INVITATION ONLY AND IS MANAGED AT THE STATE LEVEL. IT IS BASED ON LINEAGE AND DEDICATION TO THE MISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONSTITUTION AND BYLAWS MAY ONLY BE AMENDED IF APPROVED BY THE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE SOCIETY'S GOVERNING BOARD BEFORE IT IS FILED. IT IS REVIEWED BY (1) MANAGEMENT, (2) MEMBERS OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND (3) THE TREASURER. THIS REVIEW IS CONDUCTED BEFORE THE FORM 990 IS FILED WITH THE IRS. THE EXTENT OF THE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 WILL BE DETAILED AS IT WILL BE COMPARED TO THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ALONG WITH REVIEWING THE DESCRIPTIVE INFORMATION INCLUDED WITHIN.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE POLICY SHALL BE GIVEN TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS, STAFF MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS OR OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS UPON COMMENCEMENT OF SUCH PERSON'S RELATIONSHIP WITH THE ORGANIZATION. EACH BOARD MEMBER, OFFICER, STAFF MEMBER, AND VOLUNTEER SHALL SIGN AND DATE THE POLICY AT THE BEGINNING OF HER/HIS TERM OF SERVICE OR EMPLOYMENT AND EACH YEAR THEREAFTER. FAILURE TO SIGN DOES NOT NULLIFY THE POLICY. ALL POTENTIAL BOARD CONFLICTS ARE REPORTED TO THE CHAIRMAN OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE CHAIRMAN MAKES A DETERMINATION IF THERE IS NEED FOR FURTHER ACTION AND REPORTS IN ANY CASE TO THE BOARD. THE BOARD HAS THE FINAL VOTE ON THE OUTCOME. NO INTERESTED PERSON SHALL PARTICIPATE IN ANY DISCUSSION OR DEBATE IN WHICH THEY HAVE A CONFLICT, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT THEIR INPUT IS NEEDED TO PROVIDE CLARIFYING INFORMATION. A TIMELY RECORD WILL BE KEPT OF ALL POSSIBLE AND/OR ACTUAL CONFLICTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST, IN WHICH SUCH DOCUMENTS ARE PROVIDED AFTER A DOCUMENTED REQUEST IS MADE BY ANY INDIVIDUAL OR ORGANIZATION.
THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS MODIFIED CASH BASIS ACCOUNTING METHOD.
